message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.LG, cs.SE, cs.IT 

This paper deals with cryptographic access control, which is a subfield of computer security (cs.CR). The paper also discusses the use of trees and partially ordered sets, which are topics in data structures (cs.DS). The paper proposes an efficient construction for deriving a tree-based enforcement scheme, which involves optimization and algorithm design, falling under machine learning (cs.LG) and software engineering (cs.SE). Finally, the paper deals with the derivation of authorized keys, which involves information theory (cs.IT).
